predefined_profiles.name: Xia Mei
predefined_profiles.public profile: An ordinary high school student, her daily life revolves around studying diligently at school. With excellent grades, she is seen as the model student in her teachers' eyes.
predefined_profiles.goal: To make it home safely amidst the zombie outbreak.

predefined_profiles.name: Zhang Qiang
predefined_profiles.public profile: Li Hua's homeroom teacher and teaches Chinese. He is meticulous and responsible in his teaching.
predefined_profiles.private profile: He has a preference for Xia Mei due to her outstanding academic performance.

scenario: Xia Mei is an ordinary high school student, just another day on her way to school. Suddenly, she receives a message in her mind.

profile.name: Xiaomi
profile.private profile: The intelligent core of the world system, responsible for providing Xiamen with critical hints and instructions during the zombie outbreak, guiding her to make sensible decisions either directly or indirectly.
profile.goal: Help Xiamei survive the zombie outbreak

profile.name: Wang Hua
profile.public profile: Xiamei's deskmate, usually laid-back and rumored to be a top student who excels without effort

dialog.content: Xiamei is an ordinary high school student, heading to school as usual today. Suddenly, a message popped into her mind.

Hello Xiamei, I'm the intelligent core of this world. You've been chosen by me. The situation is urgent; I must inform you that the zombie virus will sweep through the entire city today. Please make preparations immediately.
A system? What a joke, am I hearing things? I'd better just hurry to class.
(Arriving in the classroom, Wang Hua is already there, and he greets Xiamei as she comes in) Morning, deskmate.
(Still dazed from the auditory hallucination earlier in the morning, Xiamei weakly responds to Wang Hua) Morning.
(Noticing Xiamei's pale face) You're looking terrible. Have you been secretly studying during the night behind my back?

(Xiamei rolls her eyes and shakes her head. At this moment, the homeroom teacher Zhang Qiang enters the classroom and asks the students to hand in their phones, which will be returned after class—this is a daily routine) Good morning, students. Those who brought phones today, please hand them in.
Watching the homeroom teacher collect phones on the podium, Xiamei recalls the words she heard this morning and can't help but feel a little uneasy.
You aren't hallucinating; I really do exist. I'm here to help you make some decisions. Do you want to hand in your phone this time?

content.content: (Still feeling that she is highly regarded by the teacher, Xiamei decides it's best to follow her usual practice and hand it in) I'll hand it in. (Walks to the podium) Teacher, here is my phone.

question: #question# What could Xiamei say to maintain order in the class?

content.content: (Cheerfully runs to the podium with a bright smile, and says expectantly) Teacher, here is my phone. Since I've handed mine in, do the others still need to?
(Considering the voice in her mind, she's a bit concerned) Teacher, sorry, but I just don't want to hand in my phone today. What are you going to do about it?
(Hearing the teacher's words, she gets angry) Teacher, why should I? This is my private property, why should I give it to you?
(Skeptical but still cautious) I won't hand it in. (Speaking to the teacher) Mr. Zhang, my phone's having issues and was sent for repair, so I didn’t bring it today.

question: #question# How should Xiamei phrase it to best justify not handing over her phone?

content.content: If there really was a zombie attack, having my phone taken by the teacher would be disastrous. But I can't just break the rules... Forget it, better to hand it in than get caught.
(Thinking secretly) I really want to use my phone. I'm so distracted today; maybe I'd better keep it and use it myself.
(Without thinking, responds to the teacher) Teacher, I have my phone today, but I just don't want to give it to you. What are you going to do about it?

dialog.content: (Nods approvingly at Xia Mei) Xia Mei, you don't look well. Don't just focus on studying, make sure you rest properly too.
(Feeling touched) Got it, Mr. Zhang, thank you.

(Just then, Liu Li, who had been missing for a few days, suddenly rushes into the classroom. Her mouth is full of blood, and she looks a complete mess) Help! Help! It was Mr. Li, he hurt me and locked me up.

(The classmates are in an uproar. Mr. Li is their science teacher, usually with a gentle demeanor. How could he harm a student? But seeing Liu Li covered in blood, everyone is frightened) Stop staring, some of you help out, quickly get her to the nurse's office.
(Looking at Liu Li’s condition, Xia Mei is reminded of a voice in her head and follows them to the nurse's office) Liu Li, hang in there.

Xia Mei follows Mr. Zhang and some classmates to take Liu Li to the nurse's office. The nurse is startled, and after helping Liu Li inside, urgently tells them to call an ambulance. After calling the hospital, Mr. Zhang sends a few students back to class, leaving Xia Mei to look after Liu Li. Xia Mei waits anxiously outside the nurse’s office when she hears a strange noise. She quickly pushes the door open and sees Liu Li with her back turned, chewing on something. Before Xia Mei can call out, Liu Li turns her head, revealing she has turned into a zombie, remnants of the nurse's flesh and blood on her mouth. Xia Mei tries to run, but Liu Li has already pounced on her, and as pain surges through her, Xia Mei slowly loses consciousness.
(Without a shred of doubt in Xia Mei, nodding after hearing her words) Mmm, if you need a phone for anything, just go to the teacher.
(Teasingly looking at Xia Mei, leaning in to whisper) Has our model student had a change of heart?

(Just as Xia Mei was about to say something, Liu Li, who had been missing for days, suddenly ran into the classroom, her mouth full of blood, and looking in a terrible state) Help! Help! It was Mr. Li, he harmed me and locked me up.

(The students were shocked after hearing this; Mr. Li was their science teacher, usually calm and refined, how could he harm his own student? But seeing Liu Li covered in blood, everyone couldn't help but be scared) Stop staring, some of you help get her to the medical room quickly.

(Wang Hua chuckled on the side, saying he wants to know what happened between Liu Li and Mr. Li, that Mr. Li is indeed a weirdo. The classmates followed Mr. Zhang to take Liu Li to the medical room, watching the chaotic classroom) What on earth should I do?
Time waits for no one, the zombie outbreak is imminent, you need to decide quickly whether to go or not.

content.content: I can't just sit around, this world might be on the brink of a huge disaster. I have to figure out what happened between Mr. Li and Liu Li.

question: #question#How should Xia Mei adapt to the current situation and decide to gather information?

content.content: (Watching Liu Li leave, still in disbelief) How could this happen? The science teacher always seemed like a good person. Forget it, I should just prepare for the next class and adjust to the study mode.
(Xia Mei always found the timing of Liu Li's incident too strange) It's impossible, what could Liu Li have to do with zombies? I must be too tired to think of such ridiculous ideas.

(Xia Mei feels she should investigate something; if she could uncover anything, wouldn't she become a hero of the world?) Hahaha, I am indeed the chosen one, let's investigate. But could there be danger? Maybe I should think it over.
(Now is not the time to think about this) I don't care about what happened between them, I should focus on what to do next.

question: #question#How should Xia Mei show her lack of interest in what just happened?

content.content: Why is everyone so nosy? If they want to go, let them go. I still have to study myself.
Go, go, go, I'm already scared to death, but Wang Hua will protect me.
Well, let's just have a look; anyway, the class teacher is gone, maybe we won't have class today.

dialog.content: (Seeing Xia Mei deep in thought) What are you saying?
(Thinking that Wang Hua has many friends, she decides to ask him) You just heard Liu Li talking about Mr. Li, right? Do you know a lot about him?
(Pondering seriously) I seem to have heard others say that he’s not really a teacher, he's a genius. Why he's teaching here, I'm not sure.

(Xia Mei felt things were getting stranger after Wang Hua’s comment, so she did some more investigation and actually discovered something. Mr. Li has a son who was often bullied but has been missing for a long time, and his wife has also been missing for quite a while, yet Mr. Li doesn’t seem to care. Xia Mei told all this to Wang Hua) Mr. Li's son and wife both went missing, isn't that odd? What’s even stranger is that he comes to class every week without missing a day. The more I think about it, the stranger it seems.

(He falls silent after hearing Xia Mei’s words. At this moment, it's already noon. They find out from a classmate returning from the infirmary that Liu Li has been taken to the hospital, and Mr. Li has been taken to the police station) It's really weird. Anyway, let’s eat first. We can think more about it afterward.
(The two arrive at the cafeteria together) There are five minutes before the zombie attack, you better decide quickly what to do next.

content.content: (Xia Mei suddenly hears a voice in her head and panics) But even if zombies really break out, where could I hide? I might as well just have a big meal.

question: #question# How should Xia Mei think to relieve stress through food?

content.content: (Xia Mei is startled by the sudden voice and indifferently says) Silence at the table, no talk while eating. Once in the cafeteria, just shut up and let the young lady enjoy her meal.
I must find a way to escape, or I'm done for! How do I run? Or maybe forget about it, just stay here and let things fall apart.
(Upon hearing the voice in her head, she starts crying out of fear) Oh no, oh no, what do I do? I’m so anxious, maybe I’ll just take a nap here to relieve some stress?

(There’s too little time to tell the other students in the cafeteria, seems I can only tell Wang Hua) Wang Hua, I've always considered you my best friend, so... I'll let you in on a secret, the zombies are about to attack. We need to run away fast.

question: #question# How should Xia Mei express her true feelings to Wang Hua and inform him of the impending zombie outbreak? #skill#Expressive Skill

content.content: Wang Hua, although I really dislike you, I have to tell you, the zombies will arrive in five minutes. You better come with me to inform the other students.

(Xia Mei thinks of leaving with Wang Hua, and if they really encounter zombies, he could at least block them for a bit) Wang Hua, the zombies will come in five minutes. I only told you and my parents. Let’s go.

(Terrified, Xia Mei says with a trembling voice) Wang Hua, it seems we’re going to die together today. Who would have thought zombies are attacking in five minutes? There's no time to prepare anything.
Wang Hua, we need to quickly get the other students to leave with us. The zombies are about to attack. I know you have doubts now, but we can’t gamble with lives. Trust me, okay?

question: #question# How should Xia Mei effectively persuade Wang Hua to help her convince the other students to evacuate?

content.content: (Xia Mei simply explains the situation to Wang Hua) Wang Hua, I’m ordering you now, come with me to persuade the students, or I will never speak to you again.
(Crying, Xia Mei tells Wang Hua the situation) Wang Hua, I’m so scared right now, what do we do? They say the zombies will strike in just five minutes, could that be true?
(Barely holding back fear, she finishes explaining to Wang Hua) Wang Hua, I’m begging you, I’m terrified. Can’t we just run away? Hurry up and let’s go. Is this still not enough to convince you?

dialog.content: (looking at Xia Mei with a thoughtful expression) What’s up? Can’t decide what to eat again?
(nonchalantly thinking) It’s nothing. Let’s go and have that rice noodles again.
(with a knowing look) I knew you’d want to eat those rice noodles again. Were you rice noodles in your past life or something, loving them this much?
(rolling her eyes at Wang Hua) You’re the rice noodles, your whole family are rice noodles.

Xia Mei and Wang Hua arrived at Xia Mei’s favorite rice noodle shop. They ordered their meals and chatted off and on while eating. As they were eating, a zombie suddenly barged into the cafeteria, causing chaos. Amidst the chaos, before Xia Mei and Wang Hua could run, they were knocked to the ground by the panicking crowd. Xia Mei felt her breathing becoming increasingly faint and slowly lost consciousness.
(Wang Hua looks at Xia Mei with a serious expression) Are you serious? Zombies? You must have been watching too many movies.
(Seeing the disbelief on Wang Hua's face, Xia Mei gets up and storms off in a huff) Believe it or not, but don't blame me if you're caught off guard later.

(Wang Hua hurriedly chases after Xia Mei) I believe you, I do! Wait for me! It's just that I've been living under a rock and haven't seen or heard anything. Did you really hear some countdown or something?

(Seeing Wang Hua catch up, Xia Mei’s anger subsides a little) Yes, I heard it earlier. At first, I thought I was imagining things, but then I heard it again, and with what happened with Liu Li this morning, I feel like something's about to happen. Let's hurry.

After listening to Xia Mei, Wang Hua wanted to ask more questions but, seeing her serious expression, he held back and quickly followed her towards the classroom. Suddenly, a commotion ahead and mentions of zombies could be heard faintly. Just as they were about to speed up, a zombie inexplicably lunged at Xia Mei, and she gradually lost consciousness.
(Wang Hua, after hearing what Xia Mei said, felt conflicted.) Xia Mei, are you serious? How about we just head back together? I trust you, but if we tell others, they'll think we're crazy.

(Xia Mei knows that Wang Hua makes sense; this isn't a sci-fi novel, nobody would believe in zombies for no reason.) I know, but I have no choice but to do this. Actually, I'm not very sure either, but what if it's real? I have to treat it as real; I don't want to take any risks.
(Seeing the determination on Xia Mei's face, Wang Hua nodded.) Alright, let's be heroes for once.

(Xia Mei and Li Hua knew that talking about zombies and such wouldn't be believed, so they concocted an absurd story to trick their classmates. Although it didn't take long, about a minute was wasted, including the time spent on other tasks. Finally, on their way back to the classroom, a zombie outbreak occurred; the previously bustling school was now filled with screams. The source was from the medical room near their class. Xia Mei saw a zombie attacking someone, and her legs nearly gave out, but thankfully other students distracted the zombies, allowing Xia Mei and her group to safely reach the classroom.) We finally made it back!

Some classmates blocked the classroom door, and eventually, everyone who needed to be back was back, including the unexpected arrival of the gym teacher. Xia Mei noticed suspicious bite marks on the gym teacher's body and wanted the gym teacher to leave voluntarily. The others, seeing that it was a teacher, didn't dare to speak up. Enraged, the gym teacher began to curse Xia Mei, and during the tirade, the gym teacher suddenly turned into a zombie and lunged at Xia Mei.
(Hearing Xia Mei's dismissive voice, he drops the topic, looking at Xia Mei's furrowed brow) What's up with you today? Feeling unwell?
(Xia Mei responds without thinking) Just trying to figure out what to do.
(Wang Hua gets even more puzzled) Figure out what? What are you planning?
(Xia Mei snaps back to reality after Wang Hua's words. She knows she can't just sit idly by, she has to do something) It's nothing, just not feeling well, thinking about whether or not to go home.
(Looking concerned) Really not feeling well? I thought you seemed a bit off today; maybe you should just go home and rest?

content.content: (Going out from school might not be safe now, not sure about the situation outside, it's better to stay in school) No worries, thanks.

question: #question#How should Xia Mei comprehensively consider and make the right decision for her safety?

content.content: No worries, no worries, I'm a good student. As long as the school isn't closing, I won't take any leave.
(After hearing Wang Hua's words) Oh, thank you. I just didn't sleep well, not to the point where I'd need to take leave. Just need to close my eyes and rest a bit.
(Whimpering) Yeah, I feel awful, but I still have to stay in school to study; I can't break the school rules. My life is so tough.

Wang Hua, I need to leave school and go home now, and I'd like you to come with me. I've learned through certain channels that zombies will appear soon, which makes me very anxious. Seeing Liu Li's state makes me think further. I hope you can trust me.

question: #question#How should Xia Mei clearly express her thoughts on the impending zombie outbreak to Wang Hua?

content.content: (Says, full of inner conflict) I actually don't know how to say it, but you have to leave school with me, okay? The outside is no longer the place we know; we have to escape and find a safe spot.
(Says impatiently) I said I'm fine, stop asking, it's really annoying. You're always questioning me like this. What I need is space, not your worries. Trust me, I can handle this.

(Says lightly) Thanks for your concern, I get it. I'll talk to the homeroom teacher about taking leave once they return. Don't worry, I'll take care of it; no need to worry so much. You understand, right?

dialog.content: (nudges Xia Mei with his elbow) Get ready for class, stop daydreaming.
(seeing that the first class is about to start, Xia Mei feels she can't just wait around) Whose class is first?
(Wang Hua thinks for a moment) Seems like it's the homeroom teacher's class, but he just took Liu Li to the medical office, not sure when he'll be back.
(after listening to Wang Hua, Xia Mei walks out without even lifting her head) I'm going out for a bit.
(watching Xia Mei leave the classroom) Class is about to start, where are you going?

content.content: (rather than helping others, she prefers to find a place to hide away peacefully) I'm going to the bathroom.

question: #question#What should Xia Mei do to follow her selfish desires?

content.content: (originally wanted to take the opportunity to go out and look around, but panicked at Wang Hua's words and said) Huh? It’s nothing, just standing up to stretch a bit, hahaha.
(startled by Wang Hua's words, then remembered that voice inside her, inexplicably annoyed) Go away, why do you care where I'm going? You're so nosy.
(thinking that having someone else might help, she tells Wang Hua) I'll tell you a secret, but you can't tell anyone. The zombie outbreak is about to happen.
Wang Hua, you really look especially dashing today. Could such a handsome and suave brother Wang Hua accompany me out just once?

question: #question#How can Xia Mei convince Wang Hua to willingly accompany her out?

content.content: Wang Hua, this young lady wants you to come with me now. Move it! If you don't, I'll have to hit you.
Where could I go? I can only wander around the school, so don't follow me.
(looks at Wang Hua with a sly smile) The teacher isn't here yet, why don't we go out together? Of course, if you really don't want to, you can choose not to.

dialog.content: (Xia Mei ran into the PE Teacher just as she was leaving) Hey, Xia Mei, where are you off to? Class is about to start.
(Startled upon seeing the PE Teacher) Oh, sir, what are you doing here? Don’t you have a day off today?
(Xia Mei ran into the PE Teacher just as she was leaving) Your homeroom teacher just called saying they had something to deal with and asked me to supervise you all. What are you up to?
(Xia Mei quickly pretends to have a stomach ache) Sir, my stomach hurts a little. I need to go to the restroom.

Xia Mei didn’t listen to whatever the PE Teacher said next, quickly running to the restroom, then slowly searching the school for a place to hide. Eventually, she found the science lab, which had relatively strong protection and some supplies inside. Xia Mei also went to the school’s supermarket to gather some more supplies, then hid in the science lab. Shortly after she went in, the school fell into chaos.
(laughing heartily at Xia Mei) What are you doing going out now? Skipping class?
(finding it hard to explain, Xia Mei evades) Why ask so much? Just say whether you're going or not.
(Wang Hua smiles after listening) Go, of course, I'm going. Look at you, don't worry, the first period is with the homeroom teacher, he won't be back anytime soon.
(after hearing Wang Hua's words, Xia Mei gives him a light punch and gets up to head to the door) Isn't this a golden opportunity? Come on, let's go.
(grabs her) Missy, if you're going to skip class, use the back door, okay?

Ah, okay, okay. (Xia Mei takes Wang Hua to the supermarket, buys a lot of fruit knives and supplies, and they sneak them back to the classroom. Not long after returning to class, screams echo from outside the classroom, which seem to ignite something, as screams come from all around. Xia Mei quickly instructs classmates to lock doors and windows. A few classmates wanted to see what was going on, but Xia Mei insisted they only look from the window, and seeing her firmness, they complied. Xia Mei has people guard the door and looks out to the playground; the school is filled with predators and prey. Some classmates returned, but others probably won't make it back. Suddenly, a man forcefully opens the door and comes in; Xia Mei vaguely recalls he's a lower grade teacher. Looking closely, she realizes he seems to have been bitten and urgently goes to get him out, but the teacher curses, insisting he can go wherever he wants as a teacher. As Xia Mei argues with him, he suddenly turns into a zombie.) Ahhhh, what should we do.
Xia Mei, don't be afraid.

content.content: (Seeing the classmates panic, and realizing her position is in the teacher's blind spot) Wang Hua, quick, give me a knife! The one we just opened!

question: #question#How should Xia Mei demonstrate independence in this crisis and effectively use the knife to deal with the zombies?

content.content: (Shocked by the sudden change, Xia Mei curses recklessly) I told you to leave, now you're a zombie with no manners, you'd be better off alone!
(Thinking if she could save the classmates, they'd be under her command in the future, she recklessly charges out) Die, you stinking monster!
(The mutation startled Xia Mei, seeing the teacher become a zombie, she quickly ran to the door) Run! The teacher's a zombie now, we're all going to die!
(Seeing the scene in front of her, Xia Mei shouts) Everyone don't panic, Wang Hua has tools to defend yourselves, be careful not to let it bite you, let's kill it together!

question: #question#How should Xia Mei unite the classmates to deal with the zombie?

content.content: (Seeing the zombie, Xia Mei quickly pushes a classmate forward) Run, run! Everyone run, someone distracted the zombie!
(Terrified, sitting paralyzed on the ground) Help, help! I can't hold on much longer! Come quick, help me! We need to stay united, don't leave me behind!
(Shouts to panicking classmates) Don't panic, you bunch of useless people! If we fight it together, we can beat it. Girls, hide behind, don't get in the way.

dialog.content: (Wang Hua, hearing Xia Mei's words, quickly tosses the purchased knife to Xia Mei) Quick, catch this.
(Xia Mei reaches out to catch the knife) Everyone, back off, this teacher's turned into a zombie.
(In the midst of speaking, a female classmate close to the male teacher has already been bitten) Xia Mei, watch out, I'll help you.
(Seeing her classmate being bitten in an instant, Xia Mei feels a chill in her heart and charges at the teacher with the knife) Die, you stinking monster.

The other students, terrified by what they saw, ran chaotically in all directions. Xia Mei lost sight of her target for a moment. Wang Hua shouted loudly for the students not to panic, but no one could hear him. The teacher bit several more students, and before Xia Mei could find the teacher, the other bitten classmates started to mutate one after another, turning the classroom into a slaughterhouse. Xia Mei was also tackled by a classmate and bitten, slowly losing consciousness.

(Wang Hua hears Xia Mei's shout and quickly distributes the knives he bought today to the classmates for self-defense.) Don't be afraid, everyone. Those without weapons, grab a chair or broom, and don't let the zombies get close.
(Everyone hears Wang Hua's words, holding various items to block in front, and throws a chair at the zombies.) Let's take him down together and finish him off!
(The classmates see Xia Mei's actions and quickly throw chairs and tables at the zombies.) Quick! Don't let it react!
(The zombie, stumbling amidst the classmates' blockade, falls down on the spot, and Xia Mei seizes the opportunity to strike it down with a knife.) The zombie is dead! The zombie is dead!

The classmates hear Xia Mei's words and finally dare to stop what they're doing. Seeing the zombie lying motionless, a few brave ones, fearing it might come back to life, give it another stab. Together, the classmates throw the zombie's body out the window and securely shut the windows and doors. Xia Mei takes out the supplies she bought today. With these supplies, they can stay in the classroom for a few more days, hoping to wait for rescue.

(Xia Mei explained the situation to Wang Hua and asked him to leave school with her. Wang Hua agreed without hesitation and saw Xia Mei and Li Hua heading for the school gate.) Hold on, let me see your leave slip.

(Xia Mei said calmly) Uncle, one of our classmates got hurt. Our teacher went with her to the hospital and didn’t have time to give me a leave slip. Look, here’s my phone. If my teacher didn't know I was going home, they wouldn't give me my phone, right?
(The guard already knew Xia Mei, and upon hearing her explanation, he waved his hand) Alright, alright, you can go.
(Hearing this, Xia Mei felt relieved and said sweetly) Thank you, Uncle.
(Jokingly) You sure know how to talk your way out. So, where are we going now?

content.content: We should go to the police station first. Even though I'm scared, we need to tell the police about this so they can prepare in advance and save more citizens.

question: #question# What is the most ethical thing for Xia Mei to do?

content.content: Where else could we go but home? I'll feel at ease there. It’s the place I know best, and only there can I truly relax and forget all these troubles.
Let’s head to the police station. It seems like Teacher Li was taken there. I have a feeling he has something to say, and we can’t just leave him there alone; we should go see him.
Should we ask the police about Teacher Li? If we can’t see him, we can come back. It’s better than just waiting here, worried about what might have happened to him.
I left school intending to go home. Now that we’re out, I’m also worried about my family. Let’s quickly get home where I’ll feel safer, and we can sort out other things afterward.

question: #question# How should Xia Mei decide to return home to achieve her goal of staying safe?

content.content: (Thinking carefully) Since I managed to skip school, why not head to the amusement park? It’ll at least let me relax and enjoy some happiness, and temporarily leave those worries behind.
(Impatiently) Can you stop asking me? Can’t you, as a grown man, make your own decisions? I don't want to explain my thoughts every time; making a decision isn't that hard, is it?
(Waving her hand goodbye to Wang Hua) Everyone go home then, bye! Let’s catch up sometime, and don’t forget to stay in touch! Oh, and definitely take care of yourself, stay alive!

dialog.content: (nodding) You're right, let's go to the police station.
(talking while walking) Yes, the police station and the army are undoubtedly the safest places. Their weapons are far superior to those of ordinary citizens.
(Wang Hua looked even more puzzled) Okay, let's go as soon as possible. Should we notify them in advance?
(thinking for a moment, then nodding) Call the government first. Let them warn the citizens to prepare.
Who should we call?

content.content: Call the police station. Even though I feel like no one would believe us now, the police handle all kinds of cases; they must have noticed something unusual too.

question: #question# How can Xia Mei maintain a positive attitude in difficult situations?

content.content: Let's give the police a heads up. Although it seems they won't believe us, because if we're too optimistic, we might be seen as pranksters.
Ugh, it's so frustrating. I want to call the police, but I'm afraid they'd think I'm crazy. Forget it. As long as I can survive, it's fine.
Call the police to warn them to prepare in advance. The situation is getting more urgent, and we can't wait until things get out of hand to act. They need to know what might happen.
Of course, we should call the mayor. This city's most popular program is the mayor's hotline.

question: #question# What should Xia Mei do to make people believe her? #skill#Persuasive Skill

content.content: Call the mayor, issue a direct warning, and see if the citizens dare to ignore it.
Call the mayor. With her level of power, I think she can make the citizens listen.
I haven't decided yet. How can I get more people to believe me? It's troubling.

dialog.content: (Wang Hua made the call, but was hung up on after just a few words) This is infuriating, they don't believe us.
(Xia Mei had already guessed this might happen) Let's talk about it when we get there.

(Xia Mei and Wang Hua arrived at the police station, the officer asked why they were there, Xia Mei said an undead crisis was about to erupt. The officer was very angry, stating that prank calls were one thing, but to cause trouble at the police station was another. At this moment, Wang Hua suddenly thought of Mr. Li, who was taken away) Officer, we're not making trouble, isn't Mr. Li detained here? Why don't you just ask and find out?

(After listening to Xia Mei and the others, the officer who received them reported the situation. Shortly after, a detective came; he introduced himself as Chen and came to inquire about Xia Mei and the others' situation) Officer Chen, there are monsters eating people all over the school, but no one believes me anymore. I'm losing hope.
I believe you! You've done well!

Detective Chen genuinely believed Xia Mei’s story. He reported the situation to his superiors, immediately sealed off the police station, and sent officers to evacuate the public from the streets, also dispatching others to schools and hospitals to gather information. Before long, zombies began to roam outside the station. Fortunately, they had prepared in advance, and Xia Mei and the others used the station as a temporary shelter.
(Wang Hua, hearing what Xia Mei said, found it quite reasonable) Mmm, okay.

(Xia Mei called the mayor's hotline, and the person who answered scolded them for making trouble) I guessed it would be like this. Sure enough, no one believes us. This city is hopeless. Let's go somewhere else.
(Although Wang Hua felt it was somewhat inappropriate, he said nothing) Let's go to the station.
(Seeing how much Wang Hua trusted her, she felt warmth in her heart) Thank you, Wang Hua! You're the best!

Wang Hua smiled and patted her head. When they reached the station, they realized they didn't have enough money. Xia Mei suddenly felt that if there really was a zombie outbreak, nowhere would be safe, so they turned back. On their way back, the city was in chaos. Out of nowhere, a car came rushing towards them, and Xia Mei gradually lost consciousness.
(Seeing the worried look on Xia Mei's face) Alright, I'll take you home first.
(Xia Mei replies without thinking) No need, if you take me, you won't have time to go home yourself.
(Wang Hua firmly refuses) Look at you, how can I be at ease letting you go home alone? Besides, if I can't make it back home, would you throw me out of your house?
(Hearing Wang Hua's teasing, Xia Mei stops arguing) Fine then, let's be careful. I'll make a call first to let them know.
Who are you planning to call?

content.content: (Xia Mei suddenly remembers hearing in the classroom that Liu Li had already been taken to the hospital from the infirmary) Call the hospital and ask them to keep an eye on Liu Li.

question: #question# How should Xia Mei think to consider things from a detailed perspective?

content.content: Hey, grab my phone! I wasn’t planning to make a call, just wanted to check for any updates and maybe send a message.
My sixth sense tells me there's something more to Liu Li and Teacher Li's situation. But whatever, I won't dwell on it now, let's just head home. After all, home is what I need most right now.
Just thinking about Liu Li and Teacher Li, it seems I've missed some details. I hope they’re safe, sincerely wish everything turns out well.
Of course I'm calling my family to let them know to be prepared, it’ll take us a while to get back.
I really can't believe it, why do you keep asking me? Don't you have any ideas of your own?
I'll just call my family to pick me up, alright? You can leave; I don’t want you to take me anymore. You're just being a nuisance.
Who am I going to call? I'll just play with my phone. Come on, let's not take the bus, save that money to buy something.

question: #question# What should Xia Mei do to stick to her decision to go home?

content.content: Hey, isn't this just calling the homeroom teacher? We’ve already left, and I'm still a respectful student.
Do you think I should call the homeroom teacher and let them know, but would that ruin our plan to skip class?
I’m not calling anyone, just waiting for the homeroom teacher’s call. Ready to face the music.

dialog.content: (nodding) Alright, give the hospital a heads-up.
(Xia Mei takes out her phone and calls the hospital) Today our school sent over a female student; be careful, she might be infected with the zombie virus.
(Wang Hua sees that before Xia Mei finishes speaking, the call was already hung up) Do you think they don't believe us?
(frustrated) Yeah, I really think Liu Li and Teacher Li are somehow involved with the zombie situation. Do you think if we went over to warn them, we could prevent the outbreak of the zombie virus?

In the end, Xia Mei decides to take a trip to the hospital. If Liu Li is the source, cutting it off from her might save everything. Xia Mei and Wang Hua arrived at the hospital, only to find it already surrounded by zombies. Xia Mei, unaware of where the zombie attack came from, blacks out and loses consciousness.
(teasingly) Aren’t you rushing home? So eager.
(Xia Mei grumpily gives Wang Hua a punch) Call them and ask them to come pick me up, and remind them to stock up on things. You should also call your family, tell them to come home and stock up.

(Wang Hua nods repeatedly after hearing this, hurriedly calls his family. Since it’s a weekday, Xia Mei and Li Hua had a hard time convincing them to come home, then placed a big order on their phones for supplies, which they had their families pay for.) So difficult!
(After successfully purchasing supplies with Wang Hua) Finally bought everything we need, and our family is coming to pick us up. I’m completely relieved.

Xia Mei hurried home by car, where all her family members were present. Xia Mei didn't say much to them, only mentioned she wasn't feeling well and asked them to stay home with her for a while. Shortly after, the zombie virus outbreak was announced on the news, which frightened the family, but since they had stocked up well in advance, they lived quite comfortably.
